summary: The Department of Homeland Security spends billions of dollars each year on major purchases like new Coast Guard ships and systems for screening travelers. For these programs to succeed, DHS must manage acquisition risks—potential negative effects on program cost, schedule, or performance. We found that DHS's acquisition risk management guidance generally follows best practices developed by GAO and others, but that there's room for improvement...
title: DHS Acquisitions: Opportunities Exist to Enhance Risk Management
